#Goldfish and Insanity#

Galilei Donna is a _fucking amazing_ anime about Galileo Galilei and goldfish or something. Brought to us by studio [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures) and directed by [Umetsu Yasuomi](https://anilist.co/staff/101583/Yasuomi-Umetsu) (he would go on and do [Wizard Barristers](https://anilist.co/anime/20053/Wizard-Barristers-Benmashi-Cecil/)...). I honestly cannot even picture what the pitch for this was. ~~If there even was one.~~

img440(https://i.imgur.com/R6qmP7a.png)

We want to do this mecha show about Galileo Galilei and there'll be goldfish... an adventure, no, a race to find Galileo's long hidden secrets before BAD GUYS find it! It'll be fun and cheery at points, but other times there'll be ___TERRORISM AND DEATH.___

~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/uAPF9iT.png) img440(https://i.imgur.com/4lkJVWw.png) img440(https://i.imgur.com/XdBTdhb.png)~~~

This is just another one of those shows that's just a tonal roller coaster basically the whole way through. Like okay, the Galilei sisters are on their adventure and they're making progress and finding the hints Galileo has left behind! But then the business suit bad guy descends and just starts shooting people one after one in a hospital because they're trapped inside due to the blizzard outside and they're complaining because they're cold.

img440(https://i.imgur.com/xdLPFQc.png)

They want the doctors to power up the lower floor shutting down the ICU and basically killing every single patient up there who are depending on the machines to live so the people in the lower floor can be... warm? Just systematically gunning them down is clearly an overreaction and evil, but it hasn't even been a fucking hour yet.

img440(https://i.imgur.com/jbMXMDo.png)

Yet they're acting like they're going to freeze to death on the spot and that the doctor is an asshole because he isn't immediately bending to their whims at the promise of money. And they already attempted to humanize the origami folding business suit bad guy earlier but then he just starts immediately gunning people down with NO remorse.

Like I get that it's supposed to be shocking but it happens so suddenly that my immediate reaction when  he just started shooting people was laughter. He had absolutely no reason to do this. Like yeah I get it from his tragic backstory that he hates selfish people like this, but him just outright jumping to brutally shooting people to death shows that he is a complete and utter psychopath. Comically so.

~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/lbFj9Nx.png)~~~ ~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/xrSF6Tx.png)~~~ ~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/N5y8f3Y.png)~~~ ~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/OMR9atv.png)~~~

In this series you have mechas, you have sky pirates, you have goldfish AI, the main characters are going around the world collecting scraps of paper that their ancestor Galileo Galilei left behind for some reason in absolutely bizarre locations (like an island they just happen to crash land into at one point after a battle with the bad guy???) and...

Then you have the business suit bad guy basically saying verbatim:

"YEAH, THERE'S TOO MANY HUMANS ON THIS PLANET. WE HAVE TO START KILLING PEOPLE NOW. AND BECAUSE YOU DARED TO COMPLAIN ABOUT BEING COLD, YOU'RE THE FIRST ONES I'M STARTING OFF WITH."

~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/3inR2dk.png)~~~ ~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/WbgeYUG.png)~~~ ~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/Rda78Iw.png)~~~ ~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/PoSkPZ0.png)~~~

I think the description of this show is a little bit off...

img440(https://i.imgur.com/ysspOFe.png)

Yeah. That's better.

img440(https://i.imgur.com/7NsEBZu.png)

And you know, it's not even limited to the insane gun toting bad guy. Like as early as episode two, the episode ends with the reveal that that true bad guy, the head of the company, apparently in questioning the mom of the sisters, violently assaulted her. I mean did she trip and fall??? That's kind of a lot of blood there, man...

~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/0LXdQB9.png)~~~ ~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/Mg9k2hX.png)~~~

But just the next episode, he just calmly says in a line of dialogue that oh no big deal she just has amnesia.

So okay wait, you struck her so hard in the process of trying to question her that she now is amnesiac and doesn't remember her daughters at all? 

~!Fun fact, head injury aside, she was faking it the whole time. Apparently, you can fake amnesia. Like she just outright admits it the whole time that she was faking it.!~

Like this guy and the origami fellow are just so over the top evil that the whole thing is just comical no matter how hard they try. Regardless of Origami's intentions (his name is Roberto), the main bad guy's goal is I guess to just make more money.

"I'M KING OF THE WORLD. I OWN THE POLICE, I CAN MAKE THESE RANDOM THREE GIRLS INTO INTERNATIONAL FUGITIVES WITH THE SNAP OF MY FINGERS. I AM GOING TO GET GALILEO'S PROCESS OF MAKING ENDLESS ENERGY AND I'M GOING TO MAKE BILLIONS OFF OF IT."

What an interesting... antagonist... ehhh...

img440(https://i.imgur.com/TlsHj5g.png)

...

...Have I even mentioned that the main sister ___time travels?___ She... at one point, she travels back in the past to... to hang around with the man himself. Galileo Galilei. It's him. The man himself.

~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/EpfzEie.png)~~~ ~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/3WCQ8Vy.png)~~~

They were literally in like the climax of the show and it... the universe pauses. Literally pauses. And sends the main sister... back in time. And specifically to Galileo Galilei.

img440(https://i.imgur.com/ZfDejVV.jpg)

Her going back into time and Galileo Galilei falling in love with her (she's his DESCENDANT) serves absolutely NO purpose to the outcome (and yet is bafflingly setup throughout the entire show) and what should have been like the final sequence of the show is paused for it for like an episode or two while she's hanging out with Galileo in the past.

And then when she makes it back, their predicament that was paused is immediately solved by the sky pirates. 

img440(https://i.imgur.com/zRSejoc.jpg)

So I, the viewer, immediately fucking questioned what the hell was the point of the time travel? But then the show doesn't even give you time to recover as they're immediately captured after this. And you know where they're going??? These sisters who did absolutely nothing to be arrested for until after they started getting chased and put into life or death situations???

They're going to ___COURT.___

img440(https://i.imgur.com/OjhgFkS.png)

BUT DON'T WORRY. IF YOU CAN'T AFFORD ONE, A WIZARD BARRISTER WILL BE APPOINTED TO YOU. NOT THAT IT'LL MAKE ANY DIFFERENCE. [THE CHURCH WAS RIGHT](https://www.nytimes.com/1992/10/31/world/after-350-years-vatican-says-galileo-was-right-it-moves.html), GALILEO WAS WRONG. ___THE SUN REVOLVES AROUND THE EARTH!___

__GEOCENTRIC FOREVER!__
___

#Conclusion...?#

img440(https://i.imgur.com/ZNEQM3p.png)

...

...I can't even pretend to try and comprehend what any of that (the show AND this review) was and I apologize profusely for it. Let me tell you, me and Umetsu really need to lay off the... cleaning supplies. Like you're supposed to use them to clean. Not inhale mass amounts of.

...But speaking seriously, I genuinely tried as hard as possible to take this show seriously. In the end, it proved to be an impossible task. I laughed profusely throughout multiple episodes and was almost at a loss for words of what I was witnessing. Sometimes while watching shows I consider to be very bad, I constantly wonder if there was even one person who like looked over the scenes or the scripts or ANYTHING and went...

"Yeah no, this isn't right at ALL." or "This comes off completely comical."

~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/b6GU6Om.png)~~~ ~~~img440(https://i.imgur.com/J39kkUe.png)~~~

Either that person did not exist for this series or they purposely chose to say nothing or were just  ignored.

I give this show a __3 out of 10__. And comparatively, I was at least entertained by this whereas with Wizard Barristers, I just remember being vaguely annoyed almost the whole way through.

But like if you actually asked me if I thought it was "bad", my answer would just be...

_...I can't believe this show actually exists._

Since the beginning of time, there have been some questions that have remained unanswered. Why are we here? Are we alone in this universe? And the most asked question of all time is how can an anime studio adapt such an abomination of a Light Novel? The author behind Ore ga Suki nano wa Imouto dakedo Imouto ja Nai (My Sister, My Writer) in Seiji Ebisu is one of the many reasons why Light Novels and their adaptations have such a bad reputation. Not only is most of the writing from Light Novel authors amateurish but they all tend to have some sort of divorce from reality and when it is put on to the big screens, you can clearly see it. A poor decision from a newly found studio in Magia Doraglier to make this their first title while collaborating with studio NAZ, hoping that the sexual incestuous factor would pull in some coin from some horny teens, but instead, it backfired, leading to some of the most horrendous visuals I have seen in a very, very long time.

If you think that youâre going to get some sort of quality story, interesting characters or comedy then you have come to the wrong place. Yuu Nagami is your typical beta male loser in high school. He is an inspiring light novelist, in fact, itâs his one dream in life to become a published author. He enters various competitions in order to get his work acknowledged. Each day brings a new rejection from an aforementioned contest, but, from out of nowhere, his sister shocks him with the news that sheâs won the very novel writing contest that he failed miserably to qualify forâand not just that but the novel in question is a âforbidden loveâ tale between a younger sister and an older brother. And to complicate matters more, his sister wants him to be the one to take credit for the novel, as she canât risk being the one responsible for its creation. In contrast to his sister, Suzuka Nagami, who probably has all the tropes her character allows, is your typical doting but controlling young sister-type-of-character. The setting and our main protagonists are pretty much a mirrored version of Eromanga Sensei with the main difference being that Yuu and Suzuka are blood-related. They have it easy you know because, with incest, Yuu never has to worry about taking his âgirlâ to meet the parents. The rest of the characters are just there to fill the ever-growing harem whom all happen to be cute or have big breasts and an artificial desire in wanting to bone Yuu. 

A teenage girl asks her dad if she can borrow the car. Dad says âOk, but you know what youâll have to do for it.â So, she starts to give him head but stops quickly and says âyour dick tastes like shit!â Dad says âoh, thatâs right; your brother has the car!â After you have that mental image stuck in your head, do you still like incest? Do you think this âtabooâ is still hot? If so, then this show is still not for you! The art and animation are pretty much like that incest joke, itâs repulsive and ugly, sometimes, unintentionally hilarious that it enters meme territory. When you have fans from Japan literally crying, âsakuga houkai,â which translates to, âanimation collapse,â in a series such as this, itâs very telling on how bad it really is. Not only is the character designs dull and have this early-2000s look where they have those âweirdly-overly-sizedâ eyes that seem to float aimlessly on a disproportionate face, but, everything else from the characters anatomy, backgrounds and objects seem to change size and form from shot to shot. It's like it encourages viewers to play a game every 2 minutes of âspot the mistake.â The production of My Sister, My Writer got insanely bad that the animators sent out an SOS type of code message in the ED of its 6th episode.

Not a good start for Magia Doraglier and for studio NAZ, itâs a permanent stain on their record. When the hideous art is in motion, itâs probably comparable to literally seeing blood siblings banging each other, you know, all kinds of wrong. The score is not memorable either, and both OP and ED arenât even worth watching through. Although this show consists of all the fetishes that people like to get off on from incest, feet, phone sex and dominatrix, fans of these things are better off looking elsewhere for a similar setting. Itâs pretty much safe to say that this is one of the worst anime I have ever seen, and a great example of the state of Light Novel stories and characters. I understand that lowly paid creators have to hustle, write a bit of sex and hook the readers in, of course, not every media you consume has to be some solidly written piece of literature, so this story will fit perfectly next to novels such as "Flirting with Beast Girls! Doing nothing but Copulation!â and "My Little Sister got Hemorrhoids, So I helped her Insert the Suppository,â so letâs not even pretend we are seeing anything phenomenal shall we? 

There is an unspoken rule in the anime fandom that we all need to remember from here on out, if an ecchi anime has a really long name, odds are, itâs not going to be good. It just doesnât offer anything to be enjoyed, especially when the dialogue is abysmal and predictable with key phrases that have been recycled through many similar shows. When you combine all of these things with a one-dimensional cast, the flaws are extremely glaring and impossible to ignore, and itâs pretty much the result of a smutty theme crashing against a wall with all the clichÃ©s that could ever exist. My Sister, My Writer looks and sounds like a deformed child from an incestuous relationship, its âromanceâ and âcomedyâ is third-rate and its fanservice is basically, âsakuga houkai!â Avoid at all costs!

I haven't seen this season in god knows how long, but yet somehow it has continued to bother me. Its flaws, in my opinion, are apparent, and it bothers me how the community has lauded this series. The most annoying part about the first act of this series was the constant need for flashbacks. 

Problem 1, the length: We are dealing with an incredibly short season(12 episodes) this means that every moment of screen time has to count. The plot is primed to move forward. And yet entire episodes are dedicated to flashbacks which tend to have a lot of useless meat like potatoe girl or just being the snow flashback. It also is used for lazy exposition practically telegraphing plot elements and spoon feeding info to the audience. Shows like Breaking Bad do their flashbacks right. Short little bits that create intrigue or shows like Berserk which orient us. Additionally, the length cut out of all of the politics. We lose that entire plot thread because the story is wasting its time. 

Problem 2, flow: The biggest concern with the flashbacks is the effect on the pace. We end season 1 with a mystery, but we fall to a screeching halt with awkward, occasionally pointless flashbacks. The makes the show crawl like a snail and makes the tone switch all the more apparent. This switch is where they rush the Armored Titan review. There is little to no precedent for this and feels so out of place. It is also terribly telegraphed in the flashbacks, so it lacks any punch. Its as if they went oh shit, we have wasted our first six episodes time to speed up the plot and throw a lot of bullshit in(Eren's special powers). 


Indeed, the latter half of the season is a complete cluster fuck. In contrast, with the slow exciting fights of the first season, the second season rushes everything. Fights lack tension and weight, and the story jumps from plot beat to plot beat. Eren's powers are thrown out of a hat. This creates a very bizarre a style change. In the first season, the plot slowly built up, and small bits were fed to the audience. This kept us intrigued and interested. The odd change in style cheapens the last episode and leaves me confused and sad rather than excited and invested. The lack of buildup creates a lack of tension.

âI HAVE HAD ITâ¦WITH THESE M-(blank)-KING IMOUTOSâ¦.ON THIS M-(blank)-KING PLANE!â
-Me, emulating my inner Samuel L. Jackson

I do have a personal tenant of "for every good or great show, try to watch at least a bad one to balance out your experience", but geezus, this was on a exponentially higher level of existence in terms of being "turrible".

I can safely say that I probably have just about had it with these cheaply written âimoutoâ shows. For as long as I can recall since first getting into anime several years ago (a somewhat late bloomer), the Japan entertainment industry has been producing countless numbers of anime TV shows, films, book series, and physical and digital anime merchandise, many of which are designed to fulfill the numerous different fetishes of millions of anime/manga/LN fans alike. In this current era, the drive by Japan to fuel such fetishes, which arenât as positively looked upon by most of the audience outside the country (especially the Western side), has become more and more apparent. This includes a certain recurring category known as âincestâ, otherwise called brocon or siscon, depending on the focused relations. I donât think I need to specify why âincestâ is a very sketchy and infamous term (thatâs someone elseâs job, not mine). While this genre is not necessarily a terrible option in terms of writing a story, it is very easy to mess up the premises and key elements of that story. For this particular show, known in English as âMy Sister, My Writerââ¦.well, letâs just say...it really messed up EVERYTHING.

STORY: 0/10
Yes, Iâm not kidding. BIG. FAT. ZERO. (ofc MAL doesnât have the â0â option, though)
Lemme explain the setup here first:
The little sister character, Suzuka Nagami, is in middle school and already looking like a prodigy. She has excellent grades, is the student council president, and is the author, under the pen name of âTowano Chikaiâ, of an award-winning light novel which is, unsurprisingly, about a little sister with quite the brotherly complex. The little sister does most of the housework due to the two living together without their parentsâ¦.
-------------
Alright, pause! By this time already, this is where I think this show really starts to accumulate with problems: the all-too-convenient plot device of no parents or even guardians physically showing up whatsoeverâ¦in fact, itâs even a stretch for the mom or dad to even be mentioned as often as they shouldâve, and I donât recall them really ever bringing up much important stuff regarding their parents, regardless of whether theyâre dead or alive. With no parental figures to keep the siblingâs mishaps at bay, the story basically sets itself up for disaster from the very get-go. And thatâs just the tip of the iceberg, which I probably wonât be able to cover entirely, cause thatâs how dreadful the situation is.
---------------
The big brother character here, Yuu Nagami, is an ordinary high schooler aspiring to become an LN author; however, his efforts have been unsuccessful up to this point, all because he doesnât make enough âlittle sisterâ type characters. (Okay, wtf, not every god damn good story needs an imouto character, ffs!). Predictably enough, the latest contest was won by none other than Suzuka, his own little sister.
Hereâs the problem, Suzuka canât accept the prize for winning because revealing her true identity to the public eye would ruin her reputation in school and toward her parents (who shouldnât really care that much, anyway). So what does she do? She convinces Yuu to assume as the identity of âTowano Chikaiâ in her place, and keep that identity for an undefined period of time. This kind of setup can only go wrong, and then someâ¦.
Throughout the entirety of the show, it wasnât made clear if the series wasnât trying to be a parody show or trying to be anything serious. Either way, whatever the case, it fails to be any one of the two, or even a combination of the two. It is a messy assortment of events where Yuu and/or Suuzuka is subjected to numerous absurd situations and events, which are usually started up by the handful of ubquitious and recurring support characters. There is no sense of story progression whatsoever; it seems that each episode tries to focusing on coming up with a painfully awkward or stupid gag or trope, seemingly trying to conjure up some sort of âpositiveâ comedy value, which is practically non-existent after at most the first two episodes. The physical settings themselves donât help much, if at all; the typical school campus, anime convention areas, and those obligatory scenes that just beg for fanserviceâ¦arenât exactly complementary or appealing in terms of trying to keep the viewers from being bored. The show then tries to implement some sort of setup for intended serious drama or conflict between the sister and the brother near the end; however, due to the lack of story progression, as mentioned earlier, as well as the lack of complexity and structure in the narrative (if there really is any at all to begin with), the forced drama comes off as just an extremely weak and nonsensical attempt to conclude what was already an aimless and pointless plot.

SOUND/ANIMATION: 1/10
Regarding of whatever the explanation is, given the way how it went, there is no half-decent excuse for how the animation quality just dip down like a stock market crash. Honestly, the character designs werenât necessarily awful at the very beginning, but as the series went along, itâs as if the animation staff themselves have gotten sick and/or bored of the showâs cringe-fest premises and non-existent story progression (which I can totally understand, if that was really the caseâ¦.though Iâm not someone who knows everything behind the scenes). The result? Utterly âfuglyâ animation quality. With each following episode, the characters just seem to become more and more deformed, to the point where one can say itâs legitimately laborious to even take a glance at them. The clear laziness or lack of motivation of the animation staff is so apparent here, and considering itâs the same studio whom did another infamous and âturribleâ show called Hajimete no Gal, it makes a lot of sense.

The soundtracks arenât really that downright awful, but theyâre at most half-decentâ¦.nothing really memorable that youâd want to download onto your PC, iPod, or any similar device. The voice acting is rather lackluster and feels very fabricated in nature, even with the intended fanservice and comedic moments (or moments intended to be comedic, to restate that). I really felt like I shouldâve had a drinking contest for each time someone in the show says âonii-chanâ or âonii-san (O-Nissan)â, despite me not being an individual with a liking for alcoholic beverages.

CHARACTERS: 0/10
Yes, once again. BIG. FAT. ZERO.
Not only the characters are one-dimensional, theyâre so generic in a bad way and are pretty much written horribly; I wanted to believe that the bad writing for them was intentional to function as part of a parody. They seem to be just made simply for the sakes of stressing the pointless gags and absurd situations centering around the notorious tropes of the âimoutoâ genre. The interpersonal dialogue among them feels dead and/or forced for the most part, and ultimately doesnât achieve anything in terms of giving any sort of positive characterization.
This is pretty much the rundown of the recurring cast:

Suzuka is the âperfectionistâ little sister who wants her big brother to do her, but is wishy-washy anyways when related subjects are mentioned, anyways.

Yuu is the practically useless big brother who has to overreact to literally every single statement or remark thrown at him from the members of his self-forming harem.

Reika is the typical bossy MILF (possibly) novel editor, and the gag with her is her self-declared solutions are to have Yuu grope her cow tits âfor researchâ.

Ahegao Double Peace Sensei (yes, she has cow tits, too, I know) is the annoying ero-novel illustrator who wonât shut the hell up about her nickname and her fetishes. 

Mai is that one overly rich girl intended as a love rival and pretty much just an addition to the self-made harem around Yuu.

Sakura is yet another annoying addition to the harem who only wants to be Yuuâs âimoutoâ (and wonât frigging stop referring to him as âoni-sanâ), much to Suzukaâs chargrin, and ultimately an obligated catalyst for the drama attempt near the end of the show.

The Kanzaka twins are honestly the only characters I did try to like, but in the end, theyâre really just the typical twins with contrasting personalities and preferences, and are merely just part of the collective friend circle. They, of course, like the rest of the recurring female cast here, also showed obvious signs of wanting (or kinda wanting, at least) the âJohnsonâ of you-know-who.

In short, these characters are not only generic and clichÃ© (which isnât necessarily bad by itself), but also poorly written and managed.

ENJOYMENT: 1.5/10
For the first few episodes, I legitimately did try to enjoy it, and it did have its comedic value at one point, but not for very long. Honestly, I was hoping at least to find entertainment in poking fun and calling out the numerous shenanigans in the show. However, as the animation quality fell, the story progression becoming non-existent, and the characters becoming more and more obnoxious, it went to the point where I could no longer physically record reactions to the episodes as an YouTube anime reactor. Watching a new episode every week actually became pretty much a legitimate chore, to where Iâve really had my obligation to ânever drop unless it becomes 100%+ unbearable or tastelessâ really tested. 

This is one of those shows where I can actually say is âobjectively badâ in all facets, and to where I felt grateful to have at least watched the likes of Eromanga Sensei (another recent, more well-known âimoutoâ show), which, while understandbly flawed, functioned a lot better in terms of character management, story-writing, and animation quality.
An even better alternative for an actually good âimoutoâ show would be Imouto sae Ireba Ii (A Sisterâs All You Need). The cast of that show consist of more physically mature characters but with more realistic traits and personal issues. The gags are also much better and more well-executed, and more of the focus in the show is on the characterization of the cast, which worked well even without a deep story. The characters also have more life to them in terms of their interpersonal dialogue and unfiltered remarks, comments, etc.
While I donât think Iâve watched enough âimoutoâ shows to literally make a public political statement about how I feel about them, I can safely say that this particular series is one of the worst shows Iâve ever watched in general.

FINAL WORD:
This show is not worth your time, regardless if youâre a casual and/or open-minded viewer.
Avoid this dumpster like the plague at ALL COSTS.
There are WAY better shows of the same variety out there.
If you hate doing chores, heed my warning. Save your time while you can.
Rememberâ¦.YOUâVE BEEN WARNED.

My work is done here.

The baby-making JRPG series, Conception, is like bad sex: building up to anything but enjoyment or climax. Call it the âBob the Build-upsâ of anime. The title and the premiseâthat was conceived by a total creep and birthed as shitâare so telling that it was going be another work of smut, but it goes the extra mile that Iâd rather drag my testicles over a mile of glass shards instead of re-watching this dumpster fire of an anime. Can someone please notify Japan that this isnât going to solve their declining birth rate issues?

How pathetic can you get? A generic protagonist stumbles upon a generic harem of 13 girlsâsome whose characters designs are that of little children and one being his cousinâbecause you know, leaving out the incest factor is so out of the question for these insane creators. And he has to impregnate them all. Why? To save a world that he and his cousin got randomly warped into so they can procreate with the help of 12 other girls to form an army of children to fight the impurities of this realm. Hold up! Why? How? What. The. Actual. F*CK!? It makes zero effort to hide the fact that itâs only selling point is sex, itâs so shameless that it even spams promotions of its website, almost begging its audiences to go there for some A1 âbleeding the weaselâ material. And speaking of weasels, there is a racoon-looking panda named Mana, a mascot of the show that not only explains the shitty jokes but also screams a bunch of synonyms for sex without even bothering to be witty about it. Oh yeah, I forgot to mention that Mana is also a molester because, you know, itâs Japan.

After some exposition on how great first-time sex is and how it only hurts for femalesâby the most annoying character of the Fall season in Manaâour main protagonist in Itsuki Yuge has to âbangâ 12 maidens in addition to his cousin, Mahiru Konatsukiso, so that the world can be saved. âClassmating,â a holy ritual to produce Star Children, is the intersection of the showâs dungeon crawling and social aspects. This means it spends the majority of the time doing it. Conception makes it clear that 'classmating' is not actually copulationâinstead, characters are making physical contact as they combine their spiritual energy to birth children. It's the implied and not-so-implied gestures during that ritual that make it far more graphic. Well, that was for the first few episodes but that gets thrown out the window that left viewers in confusion saying, âWhat happened to the love thing being a holy ritual?â Because now we have threesomes, censor bars over actual penetration. Being tongue-in-cheek about presenting the ecchi-harem-isekai while doing nothing new with them is just obnoxious. If it was about sex being a major plot point then why didn't it just be a hentai show? 

It would make sense to go the hentai route instead of blue balling its fanbase with the trashy premise and a football team-sized harem of anime beauties: The cousin, Mahiru. The âWants to bone her Brotherâs lookalikeâ Reone. The template tsundere, Ruka. The standard Loliâs, Colette and Yuzuha. The tomboy Tarua. The Dancing Farun. The religious dominatrix Arie. The âLet me gaze at your crystalâ Liris and Lirie. The teacher Mirei. The shy animal lover Sue. The Stockholm Syndrome Femiruna and the passionate Alfie. All of them designed as big busty bombshells or resembling little children. Conception is not even worth it for the ecchi.
